Reviews.Title: “Great value but jacuzzi had heat turned off and was unusable.”
Reviews.Author: mountainwoman2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed recently mainly because we wanted a good value with a pool for an overnighter. The room was pleasantly surprising. Comfortable king bed with microwave and mini fridge. However, when we went to the pool are we were told by the maintenance staff that they turn off the heat to the pool and jacuzzi April 1. The water temp was 60 degrees totally unusable. Very disappointing. Other guests in the pool area shared our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE-PROPERTY UNSAFE, MANAGEMENT NOT TRUTHFUL”
Reviews.Author: c d
Reviews.Content: This property is not properly maintained! The room that I stayed in did not have a smoke detector. It was wired in on the ceiling, but no device was there. Another guest told me lady they did not have a smoke detector. The elevator is dirty and looks more like a service elevator than one for guests. Our room smelled of smoke, eventhough we asked for non-smoking. The pool area at this property was not properly maintained. While I was there, a little paper sign stated the Spa was not working, but children and adults still used it. If the spa was off limits, they should have covered or roped it off to prevent people from using it. Sunday morning, the pool deck was littered with beer cans and trash. It was not cleaned up until about 10 am. There was no sign on or around the pool area for the hours of the pool and spa-at 7:30 am there were kids and adults in the pool. At that time the deep end was cloudy. I went to the front desk and asked them when the pool got cleaned. They said he would be there. Sometime after 10 am I noticed the pool had turned green and you could not see the bottom of the deep end. The pool guy finally got there and I spoke to the him. He said he could not correct the problem and I went back to front desk to discuss the pool and asked for a discount on my stay as I clearly would not have stayed there without a pool. They gave me $10 off, but with attitude! I still paid more for this hotel than one without a pool. The on-site manager told me it was inspected this morning and they would not be closing the pool as it was fine. I repeated back to her calmly, “you are telling me that the county came and inspected it today?...it is Sunday” She said yes. That is not true! The management should have been truthful about such an important issue. Today I contacted the Swimming Pool Inspection department for Maricopa County. I knew the manager lied about a serious public health problem. The last date this pool was inspected by the county was September 2011. No inspection occured on Sunday, the County told me they don't work on the weekends. You do not lie to customers to make them happy, especially about a public safety issue. I also waited very long to get a print-out of my bill - over 10 minutes to print it out! Front desk seemed over-worked and stressed. It makes sense when the property is so run-down....they must have to deal with all sorts of problems and cranky customers. Property owner should take care of problems and make this a good hotel and train your employees how to deal with problems. customer service is key in the hotel business. BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL - MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS - DIRTY POOL - ETC

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid, be very afraid”
Reviews.Author: J J
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this location several times in the past during Phoenix Bike Week......NEVER AGAIN! Property had turned into a dump....broken dryers and washing machines piled in back side of property, rooms were NOT CLEAN.....knew the sheets in our room were previously slept on w/out being changed. Dirty carpet, no refrigerator, no microwave ......had to ask for a refrigerator to be delivered and was asked "why, do you need one?". Toilets not cleaned, no light in bathroom....had to call to have that replaced also. Electrical plugs did not work. Watched maid "cleaning" (I use the word lightly) rooms the day we checked out, never saw dirty sheets come out of rooms and the vaccum NEVER came off her cart. Two nights cost us $184.......when we checked out, we advised of conditions.....they didn't care and didn't want to hear it.........$184 for two night in HELL!

Reviews.Title: “I don't expect 5 star, but I do expect clean. NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Dom85718
Reviews.Content: Carpet was FILTHY, hadn't been vacuumed, the light in the bathroom was burnt out. When they replaced the light, that is when I noticed the toilet hadn't been cleaned properly. The shower didn't just drip, it RAN all night, and you couldn't shut it off. However, the only part of renovation that hit this room, was the bathroom, and they didn't even finish it properly.(gaskets to stop the leaking) The bedspread was nasty and dirty. The bed was very uncomfortable-hard as a rock. There was no iron, and just as well, because the cover on the board was disgusting. Trying to find a plug in the room was treasure hunt. When I did find one,I worried that it might cause a fire if the plug was used.The response from the front desk with a complaint was practically none existent. We had stayed in this hotel several years ago and had a wonderful experience. NEVER again. I recommend the fire marshal go check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy, and disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Cwazey
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived I was optimistic. The pool looked nice and the front of the building was nicely landscaped and clean. Then we drove to the back where our room was. We were greeted by a homeless man begging for change sitting by broken hotel furniture in the parking lot. The door to the room needed a little extra momentum to shut. I am sure the neighboring rooms loved it. There was a large gap under the door that really helped the parking lot sounds come into the room nicely. The walls were thin so I got the opportunity to listen to Everything in the next room all night. Both beds had cigarette burns in the sheets in our non smoking room. The ironing board was burnt and discolored bad. There were stains on the inside of the shower curtain that I didn't want to inspect close enough to find out if it was mold or boogers(you get the idea ). The shower leaked all night. I will not stay here again. The staff was very friendly and nice though. The information on the hotel says newly renovated. Our room defenatly wasn't newly remodles. The carpet was old and worn out. I have to admit that I have never seen chairs used as bedside tables in a hotel. Now I have.

Reviews.Title: “Should've listened to the poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: Melneli R
Reviews.Content: Aside from the bad side of town where this hotel is located, the obnoxiously rude staff, the offensive odor of manure in the hallways, the difficulty of opening an obviously non-serviceable door to our room, dirty carpets, sticky fingerprints on phones, remotes for two TV's nowhere in sight (not to mention the staff's unwillingness to remedy the problem), dirty bathtub, broken screen door to the balcony, missing vents on outdated AC/heater unit, missing smoke detectors, hair on pillow cases, stiff mattresses, constant scent of ashtrays in room...where am I going with this? I haven't found anything positive to say about this family suite and I've only been here one hour. Maybe I'll go to sleep, wake up & discover this has all been a terrible dream...wishful thinking. I can only hope that they make up for this terrible experience with a wonderful continental breakfast. Please don't make the same mistake I made...listen to the reviews, save your money, and go elsewhere. If I can keep one person from going through the torture my family has endured, I will have not gone through this horrendous experience in vain.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very rude.”
Reviews.Author: kelleypieper
Reviews.Content: Don,t know her name,but the heavy set gal,at front desk,was the rudest person,ive met so far.room was dirty,the door to my room didnt lock right,you could just push door,and it would open.,i worried about getting robbed all night!and i itched all night,bedbuggs is right!never again,nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: heyjeffw
Reviews.Content: Bedbugs. AC barely functioning. Then the run-around where management never available to answer 4 phone calls & 2 letters.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganGirl_21
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to anything these other people are saying... this hotel is great. It provides free WI-FI and free breakfast, which was descent. The service was good and efficient. Every time I called for room service from"Door to Door" catering, I got my request very fast and I never had any trouble with the employees. The atmosphere of the room is comfortable and clean. The pool area is peaceful and the pool was perfect. It is a nice location and I felt safe. My night sleep was relaxing and I didn't hear any outside noises. I highly recomend this hotel to anyone and everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: boopdiva
Reviews.Content: The day staff was not as nice as the night staff. The free breakfast was nice, but stopped serving at 9 and they have eggs, but no meat, which I found odd. It appears that there are some people that must live on the property because I walked by a room one evening that had a flat screen tv in it and a sofa and the guy stood outside the room smoking and watching tv through the window. We got a good weekly rate, but we were staying with our two children and they gave us a very tiny room. The desk chair would block everyone's way to the bathroom. We were in a non smoking room, but our blankets had cigarette holes, and my husband laid down on the floor to find one of our daughters toys and found an old bracelet and a tupperware dish under the dresser. Housekeeping was very efficient and had to work around the playpen we had to buy because the hotel did not have one as advertised. We offered to let them have the one we bought for a discount, but they did not bite, so we donated it. All in all, it was not the worst place I have ever stayed, but I probably won't stay there again. It is obvious that they had redone the bathrooms. They were pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GS1770Leader
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was on the verge of unfriendly at check in (night staff was very nice). Room was not cleaned properly (dirty plastic spoons on floor). Towels provided were old and uncomfortable. They were also very small - barely bigger than a kitchen towel. It was nearly impossible to get the key card to work to open room door. The breakfast was a joke - eggs were almost raw, waffle maker was dirty, juice was watered down and when I asked for water to drink I was told there was none available! The pool was clean but a lot of the poolside chairs were broken. Water was over chlorinated and very cold

Reviews.Title: “Avoid- Not worth the daily rate”
Reviews.Author: travelerisme345
Reviews.Content: It is a run down large, old motel with poor service and everything smells, looks and is cheap. Would be worth no more than U$30-35.00 a day. For this rate go for Comfort Inn Scottsdale which is way under-priced compared to this motel.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here not knowing the reviews....”
Reviews.Author: jpb56
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel are right on the money. We didn't see any homeless sleeping on the walks but I did see high security at the walmart right behind the hotel. It was to late to back out. Had I gonr to walmart first I would not of stayed. If you have kids I would avoid all together.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: LeeJags
Reviews.Content: This was the first place that I have ever stayed that I was concerned for the safety of myself and everyone else that was in our travel party. First of all DO NOT trust the pictures that you see on their website. The rooms may have the same headboards and set up, but they do not resemble anything close to what they show! Our Alarm clock was unplugged because it kept falling out of the broken socket, showed no time, yet still went off at 7am every morning. The good news about the alarm clock was that I was already up from a combination of different disturbances every night!!!! Whether it be some hoodlum screaming at the top of his lungs to some other hoodlum or some child screaming, or someone blasting their car stereo so loud that I thought I had head phones on. All of that would start at about sun down and go to about 4am. Ohh and the laundry... Hopefully, you don't have to do any because it is always full and I almost got assaulted because I moved some guys stuff out of the washer that had been their all day. I am pretty sure that a lot of the people staying at this hotel actually live there. For all of the activity I did not really see or hear any police... maybe they have given up on that area.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities renovated but need to renovate clientele too”
Reviews.Author: phoebe52
Reviews.Content: A lot of money has been sunk into this hotel since Victory took it over from Comfort Inn. Bathrooms all have new tile and stone tubsurrounds and bathrooms were clean as was room in general. Breakfast was the typical fare for a free breakfast...Problem with locks on door..key didn't work half the time due to adjustment of lock or replacement needed. TV gets very few channels but not an issue with us. Location is very convenient. The problem is the clientele they attract. People are running and wandering around all night screaming and yelling. Lots of vehicles coming and going with full base thumping loudly at all hours of the night.Security is definitely an issue. Rap music is constantly being played loudly and fights are common on the balconies and stairwells. Police were there a couple of times. There are lots of security cameras around the property but we didn't feel safe leaving our vehicle parked where we couldn't see it. They promise a fridge, microwave and coffee maker but this isn't the case, although they did provide a coffee maker when requested. They need to develop a no tolerance policy with regards to noise and put more emphasis on security On checkin front desk was extremely slow and wouldn't accomodate us to have our travelling companionput in a room near us.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck never again”
Reviews.Author: TRVLFmly
Reviews.Content: This place was in a very bad location and very dirty. Our room was given away but we were still given keys to it. We walked in on someone. There were a bunch of questionable people out in front of our door and children run up and down screaming. We turned around and left. Front desk guy apologized and said we should get a refund but he couldn't give it to us since we booked through Orbitz. This is in a bad location. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Descant
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Inn is very convenient and clean. It's proximity to nearby restaurants is a plus. Right off Interstate-17. Parking is ample. Free WI-FI... 1 good size heated pool and a spa too. Room is clean. And guess what.. they have a good hot breakfast. We enjoyed the heated pool more than anything else, my kids had a real fun after coming from a dusty and hot weather in grand canyon. Everything was worth it... Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: amzieAustralia
Reviews.Content: We only paid $45 for this room which was a bargin! room was clean, spacey and the hotel had a great pool. We did have trouble with our room key but it was very quickly fixed by the staff members. Downsides would be that the wireless internet constantly cut out, ended up giving up on it after it disconnected every few mins. The area is a little rough but close to shops.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a first night if flying long haul into Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: MTFTaunton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night having arrived at Phoenix Sky Harbor from the UK at 6pm local time / 1am our time. The hotel was easy to find, in a safe location and the rooms clean and comfortable, there are several places to eat within walking distance and a Walmart too if you've forgotten anything which is ideal for a first night when tired as no driving was involved. Basic but nice breakfast the next morning and straight on the freeway towards the Grand Canyon - Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret! Great staff, great price!”
Reviews.Author: abqwolfe
Reviews.Content: This property is a hidden jewel in the northern part of Phoenix – just a short drive from the exit off 101 Loop and 19th Ave south to Bell, then left. If we have to complain about something, it is that the sign is hard to read at night since as it is a bit low and the hotel sits back from the street a bit. However, everything else about the hotel is great – from the outstanding front desk staff who did a great job of quickly checking in our group, to the manager, Jon Fontanna, who was extremely accommodating. The hotel is clean, the rooms comfortable and the prices VERY reasonable and it appeared that every room had a microwave and fridge. There is PLENTY of parking and Wal-Mart next door! Our group of 23 riders really enjoyed our stay and we didn’t mind that the hotel is approximately 12 miles from the actual bike rally venue at West World. Had we stayed near West World in Scottsdale, we would have paid triple the price! The morning breakfast was just enough to get us on our way and hold us until lunch. The attendant worked hard every day to keep the scrambled eggs and biscuits & gravy coming, and everything was always stocked. There was also a waffle maker, along with cold cereal, oatmeal, fruit and pastries. We are already planning our trip in April 2010 and intend to stay at the Comfort Inn North at Bell & 17th Ave. Thank you again to the staff and management – you all deserve a raise!! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay I've Had At A Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: nikoellynn3
Reviews.Content: I frequently fly to phoenix for business and I always stay at the Comfort Inn in North Phoenix. The rooms are always very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The pool is beautiful and the price is affordable. Overall it's always a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: newmexicomommy
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel unexpectedly after fleeing a terrible hotel down the street my husband had reserved sight-unseen (he hadn't bothered to check TripAdvisor, needless to say). We were VERY pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Nice rooms (a bit small but still nice), very lovely little pool area with a great pool, great breakfast in the morning with eggs, etc. It was quiet and the property seems well-managed. Everything we have come to expect from a Comfort Inn, which has become our go-to hotel chain when we travel on short notice. Not really a "destination hotel" but more than adequate for a short stay or business trip. It's very convenient to the freeway. We found it very comfortable and it more than suited our needs and saved us from what would definitely have been a horrible stay down the street :)

Reviews.Title: “An absolute "Gem" of a property”
Reviews.Author: crotchscratcher
Reviews.Content: This was undoubtedly the most pleasant and peaceful stay I have ever experienced in any motel/hotel property. The calm atmosphere both inside and outside the property allowed us to get some well deserved rest. The staff were superb and the room we stayed in smelled like fresh cut flowers the entire time. The comforters on the beds had to be brand new and the pillows were extremely light and fluffy. The sheets were almost like satin. We really felt like royalty our entire stay. I would recommend this property to heads of state and other visiting dignataries.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: moval
Reviews.Content: Date: March 30 - April 1, 2007 Reviewer:Southern California This was a great disapointment to say the least. The rooms were very small. Our room key did'nt work we had to wait for it to be re-keyed also there were several other guest complaining that their key did not work.. The hotel offers a small laundry area and the machines were out of order. The outside area/grounds were in poor condition. The staff however, were nice and kind but this place was in bad shape as far as I'm concern. They really need to re-vamp this place .

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: lindapatterson
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and comfortable. Our shower did not work and we had an inch gap of open space under our door. The Front desk staff were wonderful and moved us. We must give the customer service here an A ++++. Until the renovation and construction of structures around the hotel we would not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “very shabby and dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This motel does not stand up to the quality we usually find at a Comfort Inn. We were promised a first floor, smoking room when we made our reservations. We were put in a third floor room and only after much discussion got a room on the first floor. We are both in our 70's. There is only one elevator for the three floors and it is small and slow and one worries that you will not make it to the top. The fixtures for the wall lamps kept falling out of the sockets because the sockets were so old. The walk-ways were dirty. Six packs of beer were stacked on the walk-way from Saturday till we left around noon on Monday. The only ice machine for the whole complex did not work. Towels and sheets were shabby, thin, and grey from age.The bath tub was very dirty and the drain plug did not work. The price of about $100.00 a night really was excessive for a room of this caliber. We do not intend to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed. Very dirty rooms. This place needs imploded.”
Reviews.Author: Tango9
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel at all costs. It needs a complete renovation or torn down and re-built. The management matches the hotel. Very dis-respectful. The rooms are very filthy and torn up.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: spojniagal
Reviews.Content: Non-smoking room smelled like musty smoke and had cigarette burn holes in bedspread. Blood or some other organic material on other bedspread. Dirty carpet. No cold water, only extremely hot. Towels were paper thin. Door didn't fit frame. Looked like it had been broken into and haphazardly fixed. Full dumpsters next to outside stairs. People lying down sleeping on outside hallway floors. Don't even think about staying here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want lots of action at 2AM this place is for you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to stay there for 5 nights, but only made it through 4 (barely)! Every night there were fights, cops, doors slamming, screens ripped off room windows, horns honking in parking lot, etc, etc. We left a day early and stayed elsewhere to get some sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently had a reservation for this Comfort Inn. I was shocked to see how run down the hotel was. The surrounding area was dirty and there were many people wandering around. Before entering the hotel, I knew I would not feel safe. We never did stay there, so I cannot comment on the rooms. However, the lobby area was dark and dingy. I do have to say that the gentleman who helped me allowed us additional time to find an alternative hotel. This is not somewhere I would consider staying at again. It was dirty and did not promote a feeling of safety or comfort.

Reviews.Title: “No Comfort Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first room was right over the laundry (we asked for a quiet room). The dryer vents were so loud, I thought we were next to a jet runway. The carpet was extremely dirty. No remote for the TV, which had a 1/2 black screen anyway, so you couldn't really watch TV. After we changed to a quieter room with a TV that worked, we found that the carpet was extremely dirty in this room, too. After the smokers moved in next door (we're non-smokers), the smoke drifted into our room, too---maybe through the thin walls. Huh!?! Lots of transients wandering through the parking lot, so I never went out alone. Forget this place!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn not so comfy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was very pleasant, however, blanket was threadbare, towels were scratchy, and toilet paper was not rough. The television was limited to about a dozen stations, not that it mattered as the picure was so dark it was hard to make out the actors. The sound of the shower from an adjoining room was so loud that we thought it was our toilet running.There was plenty of hot water, however, it was so hot that you could easily scald yourself if you weren't very careful. Only one washcloth was provided. Last but not least the carpet was so dirty that when I stepped into the tub to shower the water became muddy. Would not stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: A Victory Inn & Suites Phoenix North
HotelInfo.Address: 1711 W. Bell Road, Phoenix, AZ 85023
